'Ammonium chloride', an inorganic compound with the formula NH 4Cl, is
a white crystalline salt, highly soluble in water. Solutions of ammonium
chloride are mildly acidic. Sal ammoniac is a name of the natural, mineralogical
form of ammonium chloride. The mineral is commonly formed on burning coal dumps,
due to condensation of coal-derived gases. It is also found around some types of
volcanic vent. It is used as a flavouring agent in some types of liquorice.  It is the product from the reaction of hydrochloric
acid and ammonia.
